From: "George \"Cookie\" Phillips" <cookie@...>

>1)Despite rumors to the contary and after thinking about how much 
>stuff I am already doing, I will not have time to work on this project 
>that much.  The only thing I would want is aceess to an uncompiled 
>version of the new scenario editor.  In fact, if possible I suggest we 
>leave full access to uncompiled version for anyone who wants it.

As Deathifier pointed out, much of the programming should be ANSI C or C++ ... more compatable, that way (for linux ports, etc)..

But there should be a chosen compiler for the 'official release', whatever that may be.

I'm not a pro coder... i'm not even really a hobbyist anymore.. but I've got some knowledge that may prove useful, and I have access to programmers with far more skill than I if need-be. :)

I e-mailed DPH privately, thinking he was gonna be lead programmer.. Obviously, this is no longer the case. At any rate, here's basically what I said to him:

I know a little bit of 80x86 asm (which won't be useful) and Java (which won't be useful).. I'm pretty familiar with C and C++ and have done minor programs for them in ms-dos and linux.. nothing on this scale, though.

I've studied computer programming since I was in 2nd grade (when I started with Atari Basic and Atari Machine Language) so I know a good bit about programming theory and can adapt to new things pretty quickly. I almost made it my major in college, but the science course requirements were a little too much, so I've switched to a different major.

... so, anyone ever coded a group project before? (and, should this be opensource or closed source?)

-George "Cookie" Phillips
Anime News Network
Co-Editor-In-Chief
